Description: Ostracon from a pottery vessel in the shape of a red rim bowl, inscribed on both sides in hieratic, black ink. At the inside five lines of text, not parallel to the alignment of the rim. On the outside remains of two probable lines, in black ink, not very well visible due to the course surface of the vessel. Nile clay with mica and voids of organic inclusions, some small lime fragments.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), D12.1, middle debris
